intro: Crambe kralikii, commonly known as the Kralik's crambe, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and arranged in racemes, often blooming in late summer. Crambe kralikii is valued for its potential as a biofuel crop due to its high oil content in its seeds.
